meanings.definition: The lower surface of a room on which one may walk.
meanings.sent1: The floor in my bedroom is made of wood.
meanings.sent2: Please sweep the floor before the guests arrive.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally dropped my phone on the floor again!
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room, making it feel like the floor was glowing.
meanings.sent5: The floor creaked under the weight of the heavy furniture.

meanings.definition: A level area or space used for a specific purpose, such as dancing or sports.
meanings.sent1: The dance floor was crowded with people enjoying the music.
meanings.sent2: The basketball court has a shiny wooden floor.
meanings.sent3: I tripped on the floor during my dance performance!
meanings.sent4: The soccer field was a battlefield, each player fighting for control of the floor.
meanings.sent5: The gym floor echoed with the sound of sneakers squeaking.

meanings.definition: To cover or furnish with a floor.
meanings.sent1: We need to floor the living room with new carpet.
meanings.sent2: The workers will floor the stage with black tiles for the concert.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally floored the hallway with too much paint!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness floored me, leaving me speechless.
meanings.sent5: The team decided to floor the entire office with a sleek, modern design.
